timeline.message:
Make Helix REST realm-aware

Changelist:
1. Make ServerContext listen on routing data paths if run on multi-zk mode
2. Make HelixRestServer use RealmAwareZkClient (FederatedZkClient) on multi-zk mode

timeline.bodyText: Why is this section removed? In a scenario where ZkRoutingDataReader is instantiated by itself, subscribeRoutingDataChanges might encounter NoNodeException if we don't ensure that ROUTING_DATA_PATH exists in ZK.
timeline.author: NealSun96

timeline.bodyText: Likewise, without this section, some ZNode creation might fail if they didn't create the parent (ROUTING_DATA_PATH) and the parent doesn't exist.
timeline.author: NealSun96

timeline.bodyText: Is it possible to reduce duplication among the handle functions?
timeline.author: NealSun96

replies.bodyText: Updated. It's hard to reduce duplication further because we need to sneak in unsubscribe/resubscribe for some callback functions.
replies.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText: The path contains"/" symbol. Would that be OK?
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: That's okay. This is just an ID - it's for display purposes only.
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: That was confusing user. In our convention, the path to a certain will be "/ID of ZNode1/ID of ZNode2".  Usually we dont have folder name is one thing and id of ZNRecord is another thing. Suggest to make it consisnt.
replies.author: junkaixue

timeline.bodyText: Would you like to make it as public util function? If yes, then move it to some util class, otherwise, I think we have internal member of _zkClient, does not need to make the zkclient is passing in.
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: As suggested, I moved it to RealmAwareZkClient.
replies.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText: Let's make a util class for this purpose.
timeline.author: junkaixue

timeline.bodyText: The volatile keyword is trying to make variable sharing between threads. Do we have many threads for using these variables, which are not able to get the instance?
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText:
Yes. Jersey spins up a thread to serve each incoming request.
Also volatile is used to as a double-checked locking idiom. So it is needed here for lazy initialization.
replies.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText: Why we need a pool? Since you already make the task driver could accept the RealmAzreZkClient, we can pass in the FederatedZkClient as input, right? And TaskDriver does not have any session aware operations. So we can use FederatedZkClient for multiple cluster accessing purpose.
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: Your line of thinking is correct, but if we made that change here, Helix REST will no longer be backward-compatible. We leave it here so that for users that use Helix REST in a single ZK mode will be able to use it the way they were able to use before (1 TaskDriver per cluster)
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: Can you elaborate why it is not backward compatible? I think FederatedZKClient can support single ZK access, right? We can make it accept single ZK while combining with multi ZK access. Otherwise, we already started multiple Servlet for different ZK works fine and I did not get the idea of making REST realm-aware.
replies.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: If multiZk system config is not set and MSDS routing data is not available (which is the case for a single-zk realm user), you cannot create a FederatedZkClient. Does that make sense? So we need to preserve the behavior if the user is not using the multi-zk feature.
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText:
I agree with that. But the routing logic should not be at service layer. Otherwise, each service using TaskDriver or ConfigAccessor will have their own routing logic.
TaskDriver / Config Accessor is instantiated from RealmAwareZKClient. Then can we make some smart things underneath for sharding key routing?
replies.author: junkaixue
narendly
